Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system with the following properties: - There should be one loop (loop_1) with four linear edges (line_1, line_2, line_3, and line\\_4). - Start points and end points are as follows: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.75, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.25] - line\\_3: [0.75, 0.25] and [0.0, 0.25] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.25] and [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 4. Transfrom the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate_system. 5. Extrude the 3D Sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.375 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: NewBodyFeatureOperation The resulting prism has the following dimensions, as extracted from the description: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.375 units - Height: 0.75 units **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side.** Please note that this part requires cutting away a portion of part 1. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.125, 0.25] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system with the following properties: - There should be one loop (loop_1) with four linear edges (line_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4). - Start points and end points are as follows: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.75, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.125] - line\\_3: [0.75, 0.125] and [0.0, 0.125] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.125] and [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 4. Transfrom the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate_system. 5. Extrude the 3D Sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.125 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: CutFeatureOperation The resulting shape will have the same width as part 1, with dimensions obtained from the description: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.125 units</description>
